build I20031211

- all runtime plugins in source
- org.eclipse.platform in source as well
- launch target
- it fails with the following in the log

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Dec 15, 2003 22:10:57.872
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:438)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:582)

It was trying to resolve:
path= "d:/eclipse-new/plugins/org.eclipse.platform/bin/plugins"

but searchFor returns null.

My self-hosting workspace is at d:\eclipse-new.

I believe this is acutally a PDE problem. When you launch it is supposed to 
construct a configuration that tells the launched runtime where things are.  In 
the absence of this information the runtime defaults to assuming a contiguous 
install and the behaviour you saw.
*** Bug 48854 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 48851 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The two problems were addressed:
1. When self-hosting with links, we were passing the URL of the linked 
worskpace plug-ins in the config.ini file.  This is bad because these plugins 
are technically empty.  Now, if a workspace plug-in is linked, we pass the  
location of the external plugin it corresponds to.

2. If org.eclipse.platform is in source form in the host workspace, then in 
the runtime workbench, BootLoader.getInstallURL() returns the location where 
the Main class is found.  In this case, it is the bin folder of the 
org.eclipse.platform project in your host workspace, which is obviously 
problematic.
Now, the config.ini file has a new key: osgi.installLocation.  
When PDE creates the config.ini for the runtime workbench, the value of this 
key is set to the location of the target platform, as is set on the target 
platform preference page.  So no matter where the org.eclipse.platform plugin 
is, we always set the value of the key to the root of the product you are 
developing for, which is what is expected.
